alert.note: Alert for Eastern Orleans; St. Charles; Upper Jefferson; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 6:15AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern St. Bernard, east central St. Charles, Orleans, northwestern Jefferson and northwestern Plaquemines Parishes through 700 AM CST... At 614 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Avondale, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Chalmette, Avondale, Marrero, Harvey, East New Orleans, Timberlane, Belle Chasse, Metairie, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Poydras, Estelle, Woodmere, Elmwood, Violet, Terrytown and Meraux. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 231 and 252. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Orleans; St. Charles; Upper Jefferson; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans
